snippet: Australian authorities said that they were investigating reports by ships in the search flotilla that underwater sensors had picked up signals that could be from the plane’s data and voice recorders.
abstract: Australian authorities leading search for Malyasia Airlines Flight 370 are investigating three reports that underwater sensors picked up signals that could be from the plane's data and voice recorders.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong, Nicola Clark from Paris, and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia.

lead_paragraph: Australian authorities said that they were investigating reports by ships in the search flotilla that underwater sensors had picked up signals that could be from the plane’s data and voice recorders.

headline.main: Ship Reports Getting Signal That Could Be Black Box of Missing Jet
headline.print_headline: Ship Reports Getting Signal That Could Be Black Box of Missing Jet
